title: Miguel Angel Munoz | Portfolio
description: I am Miguel, electronic engineer and passionate about technology.
name: Miguel Angel Muñoz
about: I’m a backend developer passionate about building scalable and efficient services. I thrive on solving complex problems and turning ideas into robust, high-performance solutions. My work is driven by a commitment to continuous learning, teamwork, and technical excellence. Beyond coding, I enjoy collaborating with teams, sharing knowledge, and embracing challenges that push me to grow. My approach is always solution-oriented, seeking not just to develop software, but to create impactful and sustainable technology. Let’s build something great together!

experience.title: IDEA Group (Institute of Environmental Studies) - National University Manizales Campus
experience.subtitle: Web Developer
experience.description: Development and maintenance of a critical public safety application: Responsible for the Early Warning System (SAT) in Manizales, Colombia, a tool that monitored real-time rainfall levels and alerted firefighters about potential risks, ensuring high availability and reliability in emergency situations. (PHP, MySQL, PostgreSQL, RESTful API, Docker, Git, Linux for servers)

experience.title: Global Hitss
experience.subtitle: Software Development Intern
experience.description: Developed and automated processes using Python, optimizing workflows and improving operational efficiency. Implemented containerized microservices in C# for backend applications, enhancing scalability and modularity.

experience.title: WEST engineering SAS
experience.subtitle: Innovation and Development Control Engineer
experience.description: I developed and implemented an artificial intelligence chatbot using natural language models (LLM) and cloud-based DevOps practices, ensuring efficient deployments with CI/CD. I designed and developed the company's official website using React and JavaScript, enhancing the user experience. Additionally, I created a backend in C# to integrate real-time monitoring applications with edge computing devices like PLCs.

projects.title: SAT - Manizales Early Warning System
projects.subtitle: Backend Development
projects.description: A project in collaboration with the Manizales City Hall and the IDEA research group from the National University of Colombia, aimed at developing a tool that monitors real-time rainfall levels and, through analysis, measures the threat level to alert firefighters about the potential risks of rainfall in different areas of the city, ensuring high availability and reliability in emergency situations.

projects.title: ESVA Virtual Assistant
projects.subtitle: RAG model for document management
projects.description: Development and implementation of an AI-powered chatbot in the cloud: I designed and implemented a chatbot using natural language models (LLM) and artificial intelligence, deployed in cloud environments applying DevOps principles and CI/CD practices to ensure continuous and efficient deployment.

projects.title: Open Source - Docker Generator
projects.subtitle: Docker project generator (in progress)
projects.description: Development and deployment of the backend and frontend of an open-source application that initializes Docker projects as a base for various applications. The project is actively developed in the open-source repository [Container Generator](https://github.com/miguelangel708/container-generator.git).

projects.title: Web Pages
projects.subtitle: Frontend development for various websites of WEST Engineering
projects.description: Design, development, and deployment of various websites for WEST Engineering, including the company's main website [WEST Engineering](https://west.net.co/).

training.title: National University of Colombia - Manizales Campus
training.subtitle: Electronic Engineering Student
training.description: 11 semesters of electronic engineering and part of computer science, as well as participation in different research groups

training.title: SENA: National Learning Service
training.subtitle: Software Programming Technician
training.description: I learned skills in different programming languages, as well as the development and deployment of applications with C# and React

extras.title: Turn Signals for Cyclists
extras.description: I participated in a group that developed a vest to help cyclists use turn signals in the city of Medellín, aiming to reduce the accident rate in the city. This initiative was covered by various media outlets, including newspapers and radio.

extras.title: Robotic Prosthesis
extras.description: During several semesters at university, we developed a robotic prosthesis controlled by electroencephalogram signals, with the aim of providing individuals without this organ a functional tool for their daily life.

extras.title: Robotics Projects such as Smart Irrigation Systems in Rural Areas
extras.description: During my time in high school, I had the opportunity to participate in robotics competitions with a project based on a robot for smart irrigation systems, where through a camera, it detected the plants' needs and was responsible for supplying water and making diagnostics.
